p: This village or urban yellow fever virus, already adapted to human and Ae. aegypti, was introduced into tropical America, probably via viremic people and/or Ae. aegypti transported on ships, during the triangular slave trade, which started in the 16th century [ 14, 15]. Upon arrival to the Central and South American rainforest, not only did the virus find susceptible New World monkeys but also new competent endemic mosquitoes from two genera, Sabethes sp. and especially Haemagogus sp. Yellow fever virus thus had a second phase of cross species transmission (African monkeys to American monkeys, African Aedes mosquitoes to American mosquitoes).
